message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.COMM, cs.SY, cs.MM

Reasoning: 
1. cs.IT (Information Theory): The paper proposes a new transmission technology (NOMA-OTFS) and evaluates its performance in terms of spectral efficiency. This falls under the scope of information theory.
2. cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture): The paper discusses the performance of the proposed NOMA-OTFS system from a system-level and link-level perspective, which is related to networking and internet architecture.
3. cs.COMM (Communication and Networking): The paper proposes a new multiple access scheme (NOMA) and evaluates its performance in the context of wireless communication, which falls under the scope of communication and networking.
4. cs.SY (Systems and Control): The paper presents a receiver design for NOMA-OTFS and develops power allocation schemes, which are related to system design and control.
5. cs.MM (Multimedia): The paper evaluates the performance of the proposed NOMA-OTFS system in terms of goodput and throughput, which are related to multimedia applications.
